poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
'A dry yin wi a twist for him, a dirty wan for me.' Another tryst
Another glass to see him through. 'Here’s tae us!' Feckless twit
And useless tit tricked out in Pictish duds. Here's tae us. Still
Their nicotine tint, the spirit-level tilt to their cups was clear
To the barman, whose cockroach whiskers twitched;
That couple ticked the boxes: place a call.
They tripped out. Never settled. Tipped like toffs.
